abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Integrated Disease
            Surveillance Project (IDSP) for India is to 'to support
            the Government of India (GOI) to strengthen the integrated
            disease surveillance system for epidemic-prone diseases by:
            (i) enhancing central level monitoring and coordination
            functions, and (ii) improving state or district surveillance
            and response capacity with emphasis on selected (nine)
            states. Additionally, the project will support GOI efforts
            to timely prepare for, detect and respond to influenza
            outbreaks in humans and animals'. Due to the reduced
            scope of the project as well as the partial completion of
            the planned activities, the human health component of IDSP
            anticipates savings of USD 15.954 million over the remaining
            tenure of the project. Consequently, International
            Development Association (IDA) has received a request from
            the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) through
            the Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, and
            Government of India for cancellation of USD 15.954 million
            from the human health component of the project.
